name: cranesbill

a plant whose flowers are pink, purple, white, or blue and have five petals that are all similar: Bees and other pollinators like single petal flowers like strawberries, cranesbill and daisies that provide easy access. For a shady area under the trees where nothing seems to grow, try the cranesbill or geranium. Synonym
geranium
More examplesFewer examplesPurple patches of cranesbill lay amongst the buttercups and clover.Other good perennials to grow in clay soil include cranesbills, particularly Geranium malviflorum.This month's magazine features a visit to a country house garden to look at true geraniums, or cranesbills. The grass is scattered with the dusky blue and magenta petals of meadow cranesbill.

a plant with pink, purple, white, or blue flowers which have five petals that are all similar: Most shade-loving cranesbills flower in spring. Single petal flowers like strawberries, cranesbill, and daisies provide easier access for bees and other pollinators.
More examplesFewer examplesButtercups, daisies, and cranesbill were all pushing through the new grass of the meadows.On the grassy banks along the track, wild flowers such as cranesbill and strawberry grew.Geranium psilostemon is one of the longest-lived of all the cranesbills so prepare its site well.
